title: Building a House
description: While building a small house you'll get to know the most common tools used in Fusion 360.

chapters.title: Setup
chapters.description: To ensure that your Fusion 360 settings match the ones that were applied when creating this tutorial we would kindly ask you to adjust the settings as followed. Some or all settings might already be configured in the same way.

steps.text: Select Perspective with Ortho Faces in the ___View Cube___'s drop down menu.
tooltips: The cube in the upper right of the workspace

chapters.title: It begins with a Sketch
chapters.description: The most common way to create an object is by starting with creating a sketch. A sketch is a two-dimensional shape i.e. a circle or rectangle. To create the cubic part of the house we begin with a square sketch on the bottom plane.
chapters.thumbnailAlt: A screenshot of a sketched square.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Inside the ___workspace___ click the orange square on the ___XY-plane___.
tooltips: The workspace is the big area in the center of the Fusion 360 window where you can see your model and manipulate it.

The XY-plane is spanned by the X-axis (red) and the Y-axis (green). You can also determine which is the x, y, and z-ais by comparing position of the axes in the workspace with the axes on the cube in the upper right corner.

steps.text: Select the Center-Rectangle from the CREATE menu.
Set the center of the rectangle by clicking on the intersection between the ___x-axis___ and the ___y-axis___.
tooltips: The x-axis has a red color in the workspace
The y-axis has a green color in the workspace

steps.text: Specify a ___size___ of 100x100mm and click to confirm.
tooltips: You can either use the mouse or press the Tabulator Key to switch between specifying width and height.

steps.text: Click on Finish Sketch.

chapters.title: Let's get cubic
chapters.description: After a sketch is created, we want to build a three-dimensional shape from the two-dimensional sketch. The extrude feature represents a way to extrude these sketches into 3-dimensional shapes. We will extrude our quare sketch from the first chapter into a cube.

steps.text: Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard.
Drag your square ___upwards___ for a distance of a ___100mm___.
tooltips: Along the y-axis that is represented in green.
You may also just type 100 into the height box.

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.

chapters.title: Raise the roof
chapters.description: Now we want to create a roof by starting with a sketch again. We can create sketches on either selected planes or planes that are created by our components themselves. In this chapter we will create a sketch on the front of our cube.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Select the ___front___ plane of our cube.
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design.

steps.text: Select Line in the CREATE menu or press the L Button.
Click on the upper left corner of our square plane.
Click on the point of the ___y-axis___ such that the angle is 45Â°.
tooltips: The y-axis has a green color in the workspace.

steps.text: Click on the upper right edge of our square plane.
Click on Finish Sketch to confirm.

chapters.title: Rain protection
chapters.description: A simple triangle is not enough to protect our house from the rain. We need to extrude our triangle-roof just as we did with the square foundation of our house.

steps.text: Click on the triangle sketch, we created in the last chapter.
Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard.
Drag the arrow to the back of the square or define a distance of -100mm.
Click Ok in the command dialog or press Enter to confirm.

chapters.title: Create some room
chapters.description: Our house consists of a solid block o material as of right now but we need place inside for people to live in. That is why we are going to hollow it out from the bottom. This is where the Shell Feature comes into play.

steps.text: Select the Shell Feature from the MODIFY menu.
Select the ___bottom___ plane of our house.
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design.

steps.text: Drag the arrow or type a thickness of 10mm.
Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.

chapters.title: Make an Entrance
chapters.description: Every house needs a door. We will create an entrance by using the Extrude feature again but by dragging it in the opposite direction. But first we will have to create a sketch for the shape of the entrance.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Select the ___front___ plane of our cube.
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design.

steps.text: Select the 2-Point Rectangle from the CREATE menu or press the R Button.
Create a ___50x40mm___ door in the bottom middle of the plane.
tooltips: You can either use the mouse or press the Tabulator Key to switch between specifying width and height.

steps.text: Click on Finish Sketch to confirm.
Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard.
Select the entrance sketch.
Drag the arrow inside the house of select a distance of at least ___-10mm___.
tooltips: Because our walls have a thickness of 10mm.

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.

chapters.title: Offset Plane
chapters.description: Sometimes we want a sketch that is not located on one of the original planes nor a plane from our component. This is when we can use offset planes to create planes that lay parallel to another plane in our design.

steps.text: Select Offset plane from the CONSTRUCT menu.
Inside the ___workspace___ ___click___ the orange square on the ___XY-plane___.
tooltips: The workspace is the big area in the center of the Fusion 360 window where you can see your model and manipulate it.
If the square is covered by the house, rotate the cube in the upper right corner until you can see it through the house's bottom hole.

The XY-plane is spanned by the X-axis (red) and the Y-axis (green). You can also determine which is the x, y, and z-ais by comparing position of the axes in the workspace with the axes on the cube in the upper right corner.

steps.text: Drag the arrow ___upwards___ or type a distance of 160mm.
tooltips: Along the y-axis that is represented in green.

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.

chapters.title: Finish Chimney
chapters.description: We will design our chimney by creating a box on the offset plane and extruding it afterwards. For this we are going to use the Box feature unlike in the first chapter when we created the base cube of the house. Both options lead to the same result. Afterwards we will use the Extrude feature but unlike we did before, we will not drag the arrow but extrude to another object. This allows us to combine shapes that have a different angle to each other without part of the roof stretching into the inside of the house.

steps.text: Select Box from the CREATE menu.
Click on the offset plane that we created in the previous chapter.
Create a 20x20mm Box with a height of 5mm in the ___middle of the roof___ by selecting two diagonal points in the plane.
tooltips: Click on the TOP side of the View Cube (upper right corner) to easier find the middle

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.
Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or press the letter E on your keyboard.
Select the ___bottom___ of the newly created box
tooltips: You can rotate the View Cube (upper right corner) to position the camera in the workspace

steps.text: In the command dialog under Extend select the option To object.
Click on the right side of our roof
Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.

chapters.title: Go back in Time
chapters.description: We decided that we did not like the look of our new chimney. It seems very boring compared to the other houses in our neighborhood. Wouldn't it be great to go back in time and change the design of our roof? How convenient that Fusion 360 has this option. You can see every steps of our journey in the timeline at the bottom of our window. You can control them by either dragging the pointer left and right or by using the arrows on the left. The Play Button in the middle shows the construction of our design step by step. Try it out if you want. The buttons beside the Play Button push the pointer one step left or right. The buttons far left and right push the pointer to the beginning and the end of our design.
chapters.extendedDescription: We decided that we did not like the look of our new chimney. It seems very boring compared to the other houses in our neighborhood. Wouldn't it be great to go back in time and change the design of our roof? How convenient that Fusion 360 has this option.

steps.text: Drag the pointer two places back or press the button left from the play button twice.

chapters.title: Round and Round
chapters.description: We decided on a cylindrical, tapered chimney for our roof to make it look a little more fancy. We will therefore create a cylinder instead of the box from the previous chapter. Draw a circle with a bigger radius then the cylinder on the roof and combine these with the âLoftâ feature.

steps.text: Ensure that in the ___Browser___ under Construction the offset plane is visible
Select Cylinder from the CREATE menu
Select the previously created offset plane
Click on the ___middle of the roof___ for the center of the cylinder
tooltips: Click on the TOP side of the View Cube (upper right corner) to easier find the middle

steps.text: Drag or type a diameter of 20mm
Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.
Reset the camera to the home position
Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Select the right side of our roof
Select the Center Diameter Circle icon or press the C button
Click on the center of the roof to assign the center of the circle
Drag or enter a diameter of 40mm.
Click on Finish Sketch to confirm.
Select the Loft Feature from the CREATE menu.
Select the ___bottom___ of the cylinder
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design.

steps.text: Select the circle sketch on the roof
Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter.
